alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 18 at 4:33AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF MOLOKAI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Molokai in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 745 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 432 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rain has redeveloped over the eastern third of Molokai. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 3 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pukoo, Ualapue, Halawa Valley, Kamalo, Kalaupapa National Park and Kawela. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 745 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
